manifest_description.message: Automatically change the user agent after specified period of time to a randomly selected one, thus hiding your real user agent
manifest_description.description: No HTML or other formatting; no more than 132 characters

manifest_action_default_title.description: The tooltip, or title, appears when the user hovers the mouse on the extension's icon in the toolbar

general_settings_hint.message: Change the behavior of the switcher to best fit your needs

auto_renew.message: Automatically change the User-Agent after specified period of time

auto_renew_interval.message: Time (in seconds) to automatically update the User-Agent (e.g. 1 hour = 3600)

custom_useragent.message: Use one of (in the randomized order) custom User-Agent instead generated

custom_useragent_list.message: Custom User-Agents (set a specific User-Agents, one per line)

generator_settings_hint.message: Here you can change the agent switching behavior

blacklist_settings_hint.message: Blacklist mode - switching enabled everywhere, except the defined domains & rules. Whitelist - on the contrary, disabled everywhere except the specified domains & rules

white_black_list_mode.message: Whitelist mode (blacklist mode - disabled, whitelist mode - enabled)

blacklist_custom_rules_hint.message: You can use wildcards such as * and ?. * will match any length of characters (e.g. *google.com will match google.com, www.google.com, mail.google.com, etc.), ? will match only a single character (e.g. www.?oogle.com will match www.oogle.com, www.moogle.com, www.google.com, www.woogle.com, etc.)

previous_settings_hint.message: These settings were used by you on the previous extension version. Keep it somewhere or remove
